title: Japan MLB Pitchers Batters Statcast
subtitle: All 34 Japanese MLB players: 118K pitching + 56K batting pitches
description:
# Japanese MLB Players Statcast Data (2015-2025)

Complete pitch-by-pitch Statcast data for **every Japanese and Japanese-heritage player** who appeared in MLB from 2015 to 2025. This dataset covers **34 unique players** across **119 Statcast columns**, including the latest bat tracking metrics added in 2024.

## What's Included

### japanese_mlb_pitching.csv (65 MB)
- **118,226 pitches** thrown by **25 pitcher entries** (24 unique pitchers + Ohtani)
- Covers Regular Season, Spring Training, and Postseason

### japanese_mlb_batting.csv (31 MB)
- **56,362 pitches** faced by **10 batters**
- Covers Regular Season, Spring Training, and Postseason

### players.csv
- Metadata for all **34 unique players**: MLBAM ID, name, role (pitcher/batter), MLB team(s), NPB (Japan) team, seasons, and notes

## Players

**Pitchers (24):** Shohei Ohtani, Yu Darvish, Yoshinobu Yamamoto, Shota Imanaga, Kodai Senga, Yusei Kikuchi, Yuki Matsui, Kenta Maeda, Tomoyuki Sugano, Roki Sasaki, Shinnosuke Ogasawara, Naoyuki Uwasawa, Hirokazu Sawamura, Shun Yamaguchi, Shintaro Fujinami, Kohei Arihara, Masahiro Tanaka, Yoshihisa Hirano, Kazuhisa Makita, Hisashi Iwakuma, Koji Uehara, Junichi Tazawa, Kyuji Fujikawa, Tsuyoshi Wada, Toru Murata

**Batters (10):** Shohei Ohtani, Ichiro Suzuki, Seiya Suzuki, Masataka Yoshida, Yoshitomo Tsutsugo, Shogo Akiyama, Norichika Aoki, Munenori Kawasaki, Gosuke Katoh, Lars Nootbaar

## Key Columns (119 total)

| Category | Columns |
|---|---|
| **Pitch Info** | pitch_type, pitch_name, release_speed, release_spin_rate, spin_axis |
| **Pitch Movement** | pfx_x, pfx_z, api_break_z_with_gravity, api_break_x_arm, arm_angle |
| **Pitch Location** | plate_x, plate_z, zone, sz_top, sz_bot |
| **Batted Ball** | launch_speed, launch_angle, hit_distance_sc, bb_type, hc_x, hc_y |
| **Expected Stats** | estimated_ba_using_speedangle, estimated_woba_using_speedangle, woba_value |
| **Bat Tracking (2024+)** | bat_speed, swing_length, attack_angle, swing_path_tilt |
| **Game Context** | game_date, game_year, game_type, inning, balls, strikes, outs_when_up |
| **Win Probability** | delta_home_win_exp, delta_run_exp, home_win_exp |

## game_type Values

| Code | Meaning |
|---|---|
| R | Regular Season |
| S | Spring Training |
| F | Wild Card |
| D | Division Series |
| L | League Championship Series |
| W | World Series |

## Analysis Ideas

- Compare pitch arsenals of Japanese pitchers (Darvish's 7+ pitch types vs Uehara's splitter-dominant approach)
- Study Ichiro's legendary contact approach in his final MLB seasons (2015-2019)
- Track Ohtani's evolution as both pitcher and batter across 8 seasons
- Analyze how NPB-trained pitchers adapt to MLB (first season vs later seasons)
- Study the ghost fork phenomenon (Senga, Yamamoto, and other Japanese forkball specialists)
- Use bat tracking data to compare batting approaches (Ohtani vs Suzuki vs Yoshida)
- Build ML models to predict pitch outcomes or classify pitch types

## Data Source

Data retrieved from [Baseball Savant](https://baseballsavant.mlb.com/) via the [pybaseball](https://github.com/jldbc/pybaseball) Python library. All MLBAM player IDs have been verified against the official database.

## Custom Column

player_name_eng: English name added to every row for easy filtering by player. This column is not part of the original Statcast data.
